communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information regarding the scheduling of hearing officers for appeal hearings related to unemployment claims under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), C.R.S. 24-72-201 et seq. Specifically, I am seeking detailed logs and records for the past 12 months pertaining to:

    The schedules of hearing officers assigned to appeal hearings for unemployment claims.
    The number of appeals scheduled, rescheduled, and heard by each hearing officer.
    The criteria and process used to assign hearing officers to specific cases.
    Any records or logs indicating the number of appeals pending assignment to a hearing officer.
    The average time from appeal filing to hearing date assignment.

Additionally, if any of the requested records are not readily available, I request that those records be processed and sent separately as soon as they become available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In October 2023, President Biden signed an executive order on the Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence. Section 4.2(a) of this order requires that companies inform the federal government if they are "developing or demonstrating an intent to develop" AI models or computing clusters that exceed certain computing power thresholds.

I am requesting copies of information, reports, and records sent to the Commerce Department by companies pursuant to Section 4.2 of the Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence. Specifically, I am requesting records sent by Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, OpenAI, Meta, Anthropic, and any other companies that have disclosed AI models or computing clusters pursuant to Section 4.2 between October 2023 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Holmes

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to and a copy of the logs of scheduled appointments for the Arapahoe County DMV - Littleton Branch (5334 S. Prince St., Littleton, CO 80120). Specifically, I am interested in the June 2024 logs detailing:

 1. Date and time of each scheduled appointment.
 2. The purpose of each appointment (e.g., driver's license renewal, vehicle registration).
 3. The anonymized identifier for each appointment (to protect personal privacy while providing insight into the volume and types of appointments scheduled).
 4. Whether or not each appointment was attended.
 5. Whether the appointment was booked online or in person with a kiosk.
 6. The duration of each appointment from check-in to completion.
 7. The wait time, if any, between the scheduled appointment time and the actual start of the appointment.
 8. The reason for any missed appointments (if available).
 9. Customer feedback or satisfaction ratings associated with each appointment (if collected).

If these records are maintained in an electronic format, I would prefer to receive them in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel. If there are any fees for searching, reviewing, or duplicating the records, please inform me if the cost exceeds $20.00.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Test Request July2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

This is a test request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miranda Carruth - Test
